medical_history.chief_complaint: Unsteady gait, generalised weakness, dizziness, asthenia, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began several weeks prior to admission, with a previous diagnosis of sideroblastic anaemia one month earlier after similar but milder symptoms. A few hours after admission, she became progressively stuporous and developed decerebrate rigidity.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 12-year history of paranoid schizophrenia; previously diagnosed with sideroblastic anaemia.
medical_history.family_history: Parents reported seeking medical assistance for weakness, dizziness, and abdominal pain on several occasions, believing symptoms were due to her psychiatric disease.
medical_history.social_history: Had been eating jewellery for 2 years in the belief that she could cure her psychiatric disease.
